title: Spiral Matrix
description: Given an m x n matrix, return all elements of the matrix in spiral order.

testCases.explanation: We go right, down, left, up, then right again to complete the spiral.
We traverse the matrix in spiral order: right, down, left, up, right, down.

solution.explanation:
This solution uses four pointers to track the boundaries of the spiral:
1. top: top row boundary
2. bottom: bottom row boundary
3. left: left column boundary
4. right: right column boundary

Algorithm:
1. Traverse right along the top row, then increment top
2. Traverse down along the right column, then decrement right
3. Traverse left along the bottom row (if top <= bottom), then decrement bottom
4. Traverse up along the left column (if left <= right), then increment left
5. Repeat until all boundaries meet

Example: matrix = [[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6], [7, 8, 9]]
- First iteration: right [1,2,3], down [6,9], left [8,7], up [4]
- Second iteration: right [5]
- Result: [1,2,3,6,9,8,7,4,5]

The time complexity is O(m * n) as we visit each element exactly once. The space complexity is O(1) excluding the output array.
